Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.hpack

HPACK header compression for HTTP/2.

This package implements RFC 7541 (HPACK: Header Compression for HTTP/2), providing efficient encoding and decoding of HTTP headers for HTTP/2 connections.

Key Components

  • Encoder - Compresses HTTP headers into HPACK format
  • Decoder - Decompresses HPACK encoded headers back to key-value pairs
  • HeaderHandler - Callback interface for decoded headers
  • Huffman - Huffman coding implementation for string literals
  • HPACKConstants - Static table and protocol constants

HPACK Features

  • Static table with 61 predefined header fields
  • Dynamic table with configurable size limit
  • Huffman encoding for string literals
  • Indexed header field representation
  • Literal header field with/without indexing
  • Never-indexed sensitive headers

Security Considerations

The implementation includes protections against compression-based attacks (CRIME/BREACH) by supporting never-indexed headers for sensitive values like cookies and authorization tokens.

Usage

This package is used internally by the HTTP/2 implementation and is not typically used directly by application code.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
RFC 7541 - HPACK, Encoder, Decoder
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    HeaderHandler
    Callback invoked when a header is decoded from a header block.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Decoder
    An HPACK HTTP/2 header block decoder.
    Encoder
    An HPACK HTTP/2 header encoder.
    Huffman
    Huffman decoder and encoder for HPACK-encoded byte arrays.
